member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Reflector
member.summary:
This class is from the Front-End for Dosbox and is used to present a 'vista' dialog box to select folders. Being able to use a vista style dialog box to select folders is much better then using the shell folder browser. http://code.google.com/p/fed/
Example: var r = new Reflector("System.Windows.Forms");

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.DataObject
member.summary: Implements the COM version of IDataObject including SetData.

remarks.para: Use this object when using shell (or other unmanged) features that utilize the clipboard and/or drag and drop.
The System.Windows.DataObject (.NET 3.0) and System.Windows.Forms.DataObject do not support SetData from their COM IDataObject interface implementation.

To use this object with .NET drag and drop, create an instance of System.Windows.DataObject (.NET 3.0) or System.Window.Forms.DataObject passing an instance of DataObject as the only constructor parameter. For example:

member.summary: Sets data in the specified format into storage.
member.param: The format of the data.
The data.

If true, ownership of the medium's memory will be transferred to this object. If false, a copy of the medium will be created and maintained, and the caller is responsible for the memory of the medium it provided.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.DataObject.EnumFORMATETC.Next(System.Int32,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.FORMATETC[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Retrieves the next elements from the enumeration.
member.param: The number of elements to retrieve.
An array to receive the formats requested.
An array to receive the number of element fetched.
member.returns: If the fetched number of formats is the same as the requested number, S_OK is returned. There are several reasons S_FALSE may be returned: (1) The requested number of elements is less than or equal to zero. (2) The rgelt parameter equals null. (3) There are no more elements to enumerate. (4) The requested number of elements is greater than one and pceltFetched equals null or does not have at least one element in it. (5) The number of fetched elements is less than the number of requested elements.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.DataObject.EnumFORMATETC.Reset
member.summary: Resets the state of enumeration.
member.returns: S_OK

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.DataObject.EnumFORMATETC.Skip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Skips the number of elements requested.
member.param: The number of elements to skip.
member.returns: If there are not enough remaining elements to skip, returns S_FALSE. Otherwise, S_OK is returned.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions
member.summary: Delineates the format of a property string.
member.remarks: Typically use one, or a bitwise combination of these flags, to specify the format. Some flags are mutually exclusive, so combinations like ShortTime | LongTime | HideTime are not allowed.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.None
member.summary: The format settings specified in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.PrefixName
member.summary: The value preceded with the property's display name.
member.remarks: This flag is ignored when the hideLabelPrefix attribute of the labelInfo element in the property's .propinfo file is set to true.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.FileName
member.summary: The string treated as a file name.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.AlwaysKB
member.summary: The sizes displayed in kilobytes (KB), regardless of size.
member.remarks: This flag applies to properties of Integer types and aligns the values in the column.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RightToLeft
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm am/pm'.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongTime
member.summary: The time displayed as 'hh:mm:ss am/pm'.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideTime
member.summary: The time portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ShortDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'MM/DD/YY'. For example, '3/21/04'.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.LongDate
member.summary: The date displayed as 'DayOfWeek Month day, year'. For example, 'Monday, March 21, 2004'.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.HideDate
member.summary: The date portion of date/time hidden.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.RelativeDate
member.summary: The friendly date descriptions, such as "Yesterday".

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.UseEditInvitation
member.summary: The text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, such as 'Enter your name'.
member.remarks: The invitation text is returned if formatting failed or the value was empty. Invitation text is text displayed in a text box as a cue for the user, Formatting can fail if the data entered is not of an expected type, such as putting alpha characters in a phone number field.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: This flag requires UseEditInvitation to also be specified. When the formatting flags are ReadOnly | UseEditInvitation and the algorithm would have shown invitation text, a string is returned that indicates the value is "Unknown" instead of the invitation text.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.NoAutoReadingOrder
member.summary: The detection of the reading order is not automatic. Useful when converting to ANSI to omit the Unicode reading order characters.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyDescriptionFormatOptions.SmartDateTime
member.summary: Smart display of DateTime values

member.summary: The user can stack by this property.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyTypeOptions.IsViewable
member.summary: This property is meant to be viewed by the user.
member.remarks: This influences whether the property shows up in the "Choose Columns" dialog, for example. This value is set by the isViewable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyTypeOptions.IsQueryable
member.summary: This property is included in the list of properties that can be queried.
member.remarks: A queryable property must also be viewable. This influences whether the property shows up in the query builder UI. This value is set by the isQueryable attribute of the typeInfo element in the property's .propdesc file.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.PropertyTypeOptions.CanBePurged
member.summary: Used with an innate property (that is, a value calculated from other property values) to indicate that it can be deleted.
member.remarks: Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later. This value is used by the Remove Properties user interface (UI) to determine whether to display a check box next to an property that allows that property to be selected for removal. Note that a property that is not innate can always be purged regardless of the presence or absence of this flag.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetOption and IQueryParser::GetOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Schema
member.summary: The value should be VT_LPWSTR and the path to a file containing a schema binary.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Locale
member.summary: The value must be VT_EMPTY (the default) or a VT_UI4 that is an LCID. It is used as the locale of contents (not keywords) in the query to be searched for, when no other information is available. The default value is the current keyboard locale. Retrieving the value always returns a VT_UI4.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.WordBreaker
member.summary: This option is used to override the default word breaker used when identifying keywords in queries. The default word breaker is chosen according to the language of the keywords (cf. SQSO_LANGUAGE_KEYWORDS below). When setting this option, the value should be VT_EMPTY for using the default word breaker, or a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.NaturalSyntax
member.summary: The value should be VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to allow natural query syntax (the default) or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to allow only advanced query syntax. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL. This option is now deprecated, use SQSO_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.AutomaticWildcard
member.summary: The value should be VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to generate query expressions as if each word in the query had a star appended to it (unless followed by punctuation other than a parenthesis), or VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to use the words as they are (the default). A word-wheeling application will generally want to set this option to true. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TraceLevel
member.summary: Reserved. The value should be VT_EMPTY (the default) or VT_I4. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_I4.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.LanguageKeywords
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a LANGID. It defaults to the default user UI language.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Syntax
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a STRUCTURED_QUERY_SYNTAX value. It defaults to SQS_NATURAL_QUERY_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TimeZone
member.summary: The value must be a VT_BLOB that is a copy of a TIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure. It defaults to the current time zone.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ImplicitConnector
member.summary: This setting decides what connector should be assumed between conditions when none is specified. The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CONDITION_TYPE. Only CT_AND_CONDITION and CT_OR_CONDITION are valid. It defaults to CT_AND_CONDITION.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ConnectorCase
member.summary: This setting decides whether there are special requirements on the case of connector keywords (such as AND or OR). The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CASE_REQUIREMENT value. It defaults to CASE_REQUIREMENT_UPPER_IF_AQS.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQueryMultipleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetMultiOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.VirtualProperty
member.summary: The key should be property name P. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with an IEnumVARIANT which has two values: a VT_BSTR that is another property name Q and a VT_I4 that is a CONDITION_OPERATION cop. A predicate with property name P, some operation and a value V will then be replaced by a predicate with property name Q, operation cop and value V before further processing happens.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.DefaultProperty
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_LPWSTR with a property name P. A predicate with no property name and a value of type V (or any subtype of V) will then use property P.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.GeneratorForType
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with a IConditionGenerator G. The GenerateForLeaf method of G will then be applied to any predicate with value type V and if it returns a query expression, that will be used. If it returns NULL, normal processing will be used instead.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.MapProperty
member.summary: The key should be a property name P. The value should be a VT_VECTOR|VT_LPWSTR, where each string is a property name. The count must be at least one. This "map" will be added to those of the loaded schema and used during resolution. A second call with the same key will replace the current map. If the value is VT_NULL, the map will be removed.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption
member.summary: Used by IQueryParserManager::SetOption to set parsing options. This can be used to specify schemas and localization options.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.SchemaBinaryName
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the name of the file that contains the schema binary. The default value is StructuredQuerySchema.bin for the SystemIndex catalog and StructuredQuerySchemaTrivial.bin for the trivial catalog.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.PreLocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: Either a VT_BOOL or a VT_LPWSTR. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is FALSE, a pre-localized schema will not be used. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is TRUE, IQueryParserManager will use the pre-localized schema binary in "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Microsoft\Windows". If the value is a VT_LPWSTR, the value should contain the full path of the folder in which the pre-localized schema binary can be found. The default value is VT_BOOL with TRUE.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.UnlocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the unlocalized schema binary. The default value is "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32".

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the localized schema binary that can be read and written to as needed. The default value is "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows".

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.AppendLCIDToLocalizedPath
member.summary: A VT_BOOL. If TRUE, then the paths for pre-localized and localized binaries have "\(LCID)" appended to them, where language code identifier (LCID) is the decimal locale ID for the localized language. The default is TRUE.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizerSupport
member.summary: A VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting ISchemaLocalizerSupport. This object will be used instead of the default localizer support object.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions
member.summary: Indicate flags that modify the property store object retrieved by methods that create a property store, such as IShellItem2::GetPropertyStore or IPropertyStoreFactory::GetPropertyStore.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Default
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Return a read-only property store that contains all properties. Slow items (offline files) are not opened. Combination with other flags: Can be overridden by other flags.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.HandlePropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Include only properties directly from the property handler, which opens the file on the disk, network, or device. Meaning to a file folder: Only include properties directly from the handler.
Meaning to other folders: When delegating to a file folder, pass this flag on to the file folder; do not do any multiplexing (MUX). When not delegating to a file folder, ignore this flag instead of returning a failure code.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_BESTEFFORT.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.ReadWrite
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Can write properties to the item. Note: The store may contain fewer properties than a read-only store.
Meaning to a file folder: ReadWrite.
Meaning to other folders: ReadWrite. Note: When using default MUX, return a single unmultiplexed store because the default MUX does not support ReadWrite.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, GPS_BESTEFFORT, or GPS_DELAYCREATION. Implies GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Temporary
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a writable store, with no initial properties, that exists for the lifetime of the Shell item instance; basically, a property bag attached to the item instance.
Meaning to a file folder: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Meaning to other folders: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with any other flag. Implies GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.FastPropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a store that does not involve reading from the disk or network. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Include the "innate" and "fallback" stores only. Do not load the handler.
Meaning to other folders: Include only properties that are available in memory or can be computed very quickly (no properties from disk, network, or peripheral IO devices). This is normally only data sources from the IDLIST. When delegating to other folders, pass this flag on to them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_DELAYCREATION.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.OpensLowItem
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Open a slow item (offline file) if necessary. Meaning to a file folder: Retrieve a file from offline storage, if necessary. Note: Without this flag, the handler is not created for offline files.
Meaning to other folders: Do not return any properties that are very slow.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.DelayCreation
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Delay memory-intensive operations, such as file access, until a property is requested that requires such access.
Meaning to a file folder: Do not create the handler until needed; for example, either GetCount/GetAt or GetValue, where the innate store does not satisfy the request. Note: GetValue might fail due to file access problems.
Meaning to other folders: If the folder has memory-intensive properties, such as delegating to a file folder or network access, it can optimize performance by supporting IDelayedPropertyStoreFactory and splitting up its properties into a fast and a slow store. It can then use delayed MUX to recombine them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.BestEffort
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Succeed at getting the store, even if some properties are not returned. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Succeed and return a store, even if the handler or innate store has an error during creation. Only fail if substores fail.
Meaning to other folders: Succeed on getting the store, even if some properties are not returned.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, or GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.GetPropertyStoreOptions.MaskValid
member.summary: Mask for valid GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS values.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.IExtractIcon.GetIconLocation(BExplorer.Shell.Interop.IExtractIconUFlags,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.Int32@,BExplorer.Shell.Interop.IExtractIconPWFlags@)
member.summary: Gets the location and index of an icon.
member.param: One or more of the following values. This parameter can also be NULL.use GIL_ Consts
A pointer to a buffer that receives the icon location. The icon location is a null-terminated string that identifies the file that contains the icon.
The size of the buffer, in characters, pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to an int that receives the index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszIconFile.
A pointer to a UINT value that receives zero or a combination of the following value

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.IExtractIcon.Extract(System.String,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Extracts an icon image from the specified location.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the icon location.
The index of the icon in the file pointed to by pszFile.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the large icon. This parameter may be NULL.
A pointer to an HICON value that receives the handle to the small icon. This parameter may be NULL.

The desired size of the icon, in pixels. The low word contains the size of the large icon, and the high word contains the size of the small icon. The size specified can be the width or height. The width of an icon always equals its height.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the function extracted the icon, or S_FALSE if the calling application should extract the icon.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags
member.summary: Flags determining how the links with missing targets are resolved.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_ANY_MATCH
member.summary: Allow any match during resolution. Has no effect on ME/2000 or above, use the other flags instead.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_INVOKE_MSI
member.summary: Call the Microsoft Windows Installer.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the UNC path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting SLR_NOLINKINFO disables both types of tracking.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When SLR_NO_UI is set, a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link can be specified in milliseconds. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the timeout is not set, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds).

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NO_UI_WITH_MSG_PUMP
member.summary: Not documented in SDK. Assume same as SLR_NO_UI but intended for applications without a hWnd.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellLink.EShellLinkResolveFlags.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If SLR_UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. If there is no thumbnail for the current ShellItem, the icon is retrieved. The thumbnail or icon is extracted if it is not currently cached.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.CacheOnly
member.summary: The CacheOnly behavior returns a cached thumbnail if it is available. Allows access to the disk, but only to retrieve a cached item. If no cached thumbnail is available, a cached per-instance icon is returned but a thumbnail or icon is not extracted.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.MemoryOnly
member.summary: The MemoryOnly behavior returns the item only if it is in memory. The disk is not accessed even if the item is cached. Note that this only returns an already-cached icon and can fall back to a per-class icon if an item has a per-instance icon that has not been cached yet. Retrieving a thumbnail, even if it is cached, always requires the disk to be accessed, so this method should not be called from the user interface (UI) thread without passing ShellThumbnailCacheOptions.MemoryOnly.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailFormatOption
member.summary: Represents the format options for the thumbnails and icons.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. An HBITMAP for the icon of the item is retrieved if there is no thumbnail for the current Shell Item.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly
member.summary: The ThumbnailOnly behavior returns only the thumbnails, never the icon. Note that not all items have thumbnails so ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly can fail in these cases.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.IconOnly
member.summary: The IconOnly behavior returns only the icon, never the thumbnail.

member.name: P:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.ShellThumbnail.AllowBiggerSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the user can manually stretch the returned image. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For example, if the caller passes in 80x80 a 96x96 thumbnail could be returned. This could be used as a performance optimization if the caller will need to stretch the image themselves anyway. Note that the Shell implementation performs a GDI stretch blit. If the caller wants a higher quality image stretch, they should pass this flag and do it themselves.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.FileSystemKnownFolder.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
Takes a containing the location of the FileSystemKnownFolder. This constructor accepts URIs using two schemes:
- file: A file or folder in the computer's filesystem, e.g. file:///D:/Folder - shell: A virtual folder, or a file or folder referenced from a virtual folder, e.g. shell:///Personal/file.txt
member.param: A containing the location of the FileSystemKnownFolder.

member.param: A string containing a Uri with the location of the FileSystemKnownFolder.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory
member.summary: Specifies the categories for known folders.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory.None
member.summary: The folder category is not specified.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory.Virtual
member.summary: The folder is a virtual folder. Virtual folders are not part of the file system. For example, Control Panel and Printers are virtual folders. A number of properties such as folder path and redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory.Fixed
member.summary: The folder is fixed. Fixed file system folders are not managed by the Shell and are usually given a permanent path when the system is installed. For example, the Windows and Program Files folders are fixed folders. A number of properties such as redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory.Common
member.summary: The folder is a common folder. Common folders are used for sharing data and settings accessible by all users of a system. For example, all users share a common Documents folder as well as their per-user Documents folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderCategory.PerUser
member.summary: Each user has their own copy of the folder. Per-user folders are those stored under each user's profile and accessible only by that user.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.FolderProperties
member.summary: Structure used internally to store property values for a known folder. This structure holds the information returned in the FOLDER_DEFINITION structure, and resources referenced by fields in NativeFolderDefinition, such as icon and tool tip.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes
member.summary: The FolderTypes values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.NotSpecified
member.summary: No particular content type has been detected or specified. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Music
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.MusicIcons
member.summary: A list of music files displayed in Icons view. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelCategory
member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelClassic
member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.SoftwareExplorer
member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Contacts
member.summary: An e-mail-related folder that contains contact information.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Library
member.summary: A default library view without a more specific template. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.UserFiles
member.summary: The folder is the FOLDERID_UsersFiles folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericLibrary
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder is a library, but of no specified type.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Videos
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains video files. These can be of mixed format.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.UsersLibraries
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view shown when the user clicks the Windows Explorer button on the taskbar.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.OtherUsers
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The homegroup view.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Communications
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A folder that contains communication-related files such as e-mails, calendar information, and contact information.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.RecordedTV
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.SavedGames
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.OpenSearch
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains federated search OpenSearch results.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.SearchConnector
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Before you search.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.FolderTypes.Searches
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper
member.summary: Creates the helper class for known folders.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPIDL(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the native known folder (IKnownFolderNative) given a PID list

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given Known Folder ID is invalid.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderIdInternal(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name. Returns null if Known Folder is not found or could not be created.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.GetKnownFolder(BExplorer.Shell.Interop.IKnownFolderNative)
member.summary: Given a native KnownFolder (IKnownFolderNative), create the right type of IKnownFolder object (FileSystemKnownFolder or NonFileSystemKnownFolder)
member.param: Native Known Folder

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromCanonicalName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the known folder given its canonical name.
member.param: A non-localized canonical name for the known folder, such as MyComputer.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given canonical name is invalid or if the KnownFolder could not be created.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell path, such as C:\users\public\documents or ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The path for the requested known folder; either a physical path or a virtual path.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.

member.summary: The known folder can be redirected.

member.summary: Redirection is not allowed.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.RedirectionCapability.DenyPolicyRedirected
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because it is already redirected by group policy.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.RedirectionCapability.DenyPolicy
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because the policy prohibits redirecting this folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.RedirectionCapability.DenyPermissions
member.summary: The folder cannot be redirected because the calling application does not have sufficient permissions.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes
member.summary:
The STGM constants are flags that indicate conditions for creating and deleting the object and access modes for the object.
You can combine these flags, but you can only choose one flag from each group of related flags. Typically one flag from each of the access and sharing groups must be specified for all functions and methods which use these constants.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Direct
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Transacted
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Simple
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Read
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Write
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.ShareDenyNone
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.ShareDenyRead
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in Read mode.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.ShareDenyWrite
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for Write or ReadWrite access.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.ShareExclusive
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Priority
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.DeleteOnRelease
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.NoScratch
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying NoScratch permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Create
member.summary: Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.Convert
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents".

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.FailIfThere
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.NoSnapshot
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with Transacted and without ShareExclusive or ShareDenyWrite. In this case, specifying NoSnapshot prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.AccessModes.DirectSingleWriterMultipleReader
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.ShellView.NavigateForward(BExplorer.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Navigates the control forwards to the requested folder in the navigation history.
member.remarks: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a drop-down menu on a Forward button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a folder in the 'forward' navigation history.
member.param: The folder to navigate to.
member.exception: The requested folder is not present in the 's 'forward' history.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.ShellView.NavigateForward
member.summary: Navigates the control to the next folder in the navigation history.

remarks.para: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a Forward button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, allowing your users to return to the next folder in the navigation history after navigating backward.

Use the property to determine whether the navigation history is available and contains a folder located after the current one. This property is useful, for example, to change the enabled state of a Forward button when the ShellView control navigates to or leaves the end of the navigation history.

member.exception: There is no history to navigate forwards through.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.ShellView.NavigateBack(BExplorer.Shell.ShellItem)
member.summary: Navigates the control backwards to the requested folder in the navigation history.
member.remarks: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a drop-down menu on a Back button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a previous folder in the navigation history.
member.param: The folder to navigate to.
member.exception: The requested folder is not present in the 's 'back' history.

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.ShellView.NavigateBack
member.summary: Navigates the control to the previous folder in the navigation history.

remarks.para: The WebBrowser control maintains a history list of all the folders visited during a session. You can use the method to implement a Back button similar to the one in Windows Explorer, which will allow your users to return to a previous folder in the navigation history.

Use the property to determine whether the navigation history is available and contains a previous page. This property is useful, for example, to change the enabled state of a Back button when the ShellView control navigates to or leaves the beginning of the navigation history.

member.exception: There is no history to navigate backwards through.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.FileFilterComboBox
member.summary: A file-filter combo box suitable for use in open/save file dialogs.

remarks.para: This control extends the class to provide automatic filtering of shell items according to wildcard patterns. By setting the control's property, the control will automatically filter items in a ShellView.
The property accepts a filter string similar to that accepted by the standard class, for example: "Text files (*.txt)|*.txt|All files (*.*)|*.*"
The currently selected filter is selected by the property. This should be set to one of the filter patterns specified in , e.g. "*.txt".

member.name: P:BExplorer.Shell.FileFilterComboBox.FilterItems
member.summary: Gets/sets the filter string which determines the choices that appear in the control's drop-down list.

remarks.para: For each filtering option, the filter string contains a description of the filter, followed by the vertical bar (|) and the filter pattern. The strings for different filtering options are separated by the vertical bar.

If the filter itself does not appear in the description then it will be automatically added when the control is displayed. For example, in the example below the "Video files" entry will be displayed as "Video files (*.avi, *.wmv)". Beacuse the "All files" entry already has the filter string present in its description, it will not be added again.

member.summary: Notifies the system of an event that an application has performed. An application should use this function if it performs an action that may affect the Shell.
member.param: Describes the event that has occurred. Typically, only one event is specified at a time. If more than one event is specified, the values contained in the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters must be the same, respectively, for all specified events. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.
Flags that, when combined bitwise with SHCNF_TYPE, indicate the meaning of the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters.
Optional. First event-dependent value.
Optional. Second event-dependent value.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID
member.summary: Describes the event that has occurred. Typically, only one event is specified at a time. If more than one event is specified, the values contained in the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters must be the same, respectively, for all specified events. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

remarks.para: Windows NT/2000/XP: dwItem2 contains the index in the system image list that has changed. dwItem1 is not used and should be .
Windows 95/98: dwItem1 contains the index in the system image list that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_ALLEVENTS
member.summary: All events have occurred.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_ASSOCCHANGED
member.summary: A file type association has changed. must be specified in the uFlags parameter. dwItem1 and dwItem2 are not used and must be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The attributes of an item or folder have changed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item or folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_CREATE
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been created. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_DELETE
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been deleted. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was deleted. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_DRIVEADD
member.summary: A drive has been added. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was added. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_DRIVEADDGUI
member.summary: A drive has been added and the Shell should create a new window for the drive. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was added. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_DRIVEREMOVED
member.summary: A drive has been removed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_EXTENDED_EVENT
member.summary: Not currently used.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_FREESPACE
member.summary: The amount of free space on a drive has changed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive on which the free space changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_MEDIAINSERTED
member.summary: Storage media has been inserted into a drive. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that contains the new media. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_MEDIAREMOVED
member.summary: Storage media has been removed from a drive. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive from which the media was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_MKDIR
member.summary: A folder has been created. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_NETSHARE
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is being shared via the network. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_NETUNSHARE
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is no longer being shared via the network. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is no longer being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.summary: The name of a folder has changed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous pointer to an item identifier list (PIDL) or name of the folder. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_RENAMEITEM

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_RMDIR
member.summary: A folder has been removed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_SERVERDISCONNECT
member.summary: The computer has disconnected from a server. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the server from which the computer was disconnected. dwItem2 is not used and should be .

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_UPDATEDIR
member.summary: The contents of an existing folder have changed, but the folder still exists and has not been renamed. or must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be . If a folder has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_MKDIR, SHCNE_RMDIR, or SHCNE_RENAMEFOLDER, respectively, instead.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyEventID.SHCNE_UPDATEIMAGE
member.summary: An image in the system image list has changed. must be specified in uFlags.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate the meaning of the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters. The uFlags parameter must be one of the following values.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_DWORD
member.summary: The dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters are DWORD values.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_IDLIST
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of ITEMIDLIST structures that represent the item(s) affected by the change. Each ITEMIDLIST must be relative to the desktop folder.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_PATHA
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings of maximum length MAX_PATH that contain the full path names of the items affected by the change.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_PATHW
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings of maximum length MAX_PATH that contain the full path names of the items affected by the change.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_PRINTERA
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings that represent the friendly names of the printer(s) affected by the change.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_PRINTERW
member.summary: dwItem1 and dwItem2 are the addresses of null-terminated strings that represent the friendly names of the printer(s) affected by the change.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_FLUSH
member.summary: The function should not return until the notification has been delivered to all affected components. As this flag modifies other data-type flags, it cannot by used by itself.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.Shell32.HChangeNotifyFlags.SHCNF_FLUSHNOWAIT

member.name: M:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.MoveWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The MoveWindow function changes the position and dimensions of the specified window. For a top-level window, the position and dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: Handle to the window.
Specifies the new position of the left side of the window.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window.
Specifies the new width of the window.
Specifies the new height of the window.

Specifies whether the window is to be repainted. If this parameter is TRUE, the window receives a message. If the parameter is FALSE, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of moving a child window.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Windows XP: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. For more information, see Remarks. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Includes a question mark in the title bar of the window. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Creates a window that has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Creates a layered window. Note that this cannot be used for child windows. Also, this cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Arabic and Hebrew versions of Windows 98/Me, Windows 2000/XP: Creates a window whose horizontal origin is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Creates a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Creates a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: A window created with this style does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE and WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE styles.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Combines the WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE, WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW, and WS_EX_TOPMOST styles.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style for static or edit controls has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT or ES_RIGHT style, respectively. Using this style with button controls has the same effect as using BS_RIGHT and BS_RIGHTBUTTON styles.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Creates a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Creates a tool window; that is, a window intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies that a window created with this style should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies that a window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles
member.summary: Window Styles. The following styles can be specified wherever a window style is required. After the control has been created, these styles cannot be modified, except as noted.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:BExplorer.Shell.Interop.User32.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: T:BExplorer.Shell.ShellContextMenu
member.summary: Provides support for displaying the context menu of a shell item.
member.remarks:
Use this class to display a context menu for a shell item, either as a popup menu, or as a main menu.
To display a popup menu, simply call with the parent control and the position at which the menu should be shown.
To display a shell context menu in a Form's main menu, call the method to populate the menu. In addition, you must intercept a number of special messages that will be sent to the menu's parent form. To do this, you must override like so:
protected override void WndProc(ref Message m) { if ((m_ContextMenu == null) || (!m_ContextMenu.HandleMenuMessage(ref m))) { base.WndProc(ref m); } }
Where m_ContextMenu is the being shown.
Standard menu commands can also be invoked from this class, for example and .

member.summary: Handles context menu messages when the is displayed on a Form's main menu bar.
